com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.saf.handler
Interface IInterfaceHandler

All Superinterfaces:
IHandler
All Known Implementing Classes:
AbstractInterfaceHandler
public interface IInterfaceHandler
extends IHandler

This interface must be implemented by all interface handlers. Most handlers should extend the abstract class AbstractInterfaceHandler which provides default behavior for a number of methods.

Method Detail

canCreateInterfaceFor

boolean canCreateInterfaceFor(java.lang.Object interfaceObj)
Queries if an Interface of the kind supported by this handler can be created for the specified interface object. If this method returns true, the handler's createInterfaceFor(Object interfaceObj) method may be called to create an Interface for the interface object.

This method should be quick to execute as it may be called to populate a context menu or a user dialog. When interfaceObj is a container, a quick check should be performed to verify that an SCA Interface can be created from one of the objects contained by interfaceObj (container). For example, if interfaceObj is a file, perhaps the file extension can be checked rather than opening the file to inspect its contents. If this method returns true for an invalid container, the createInterfaceFor(Object interfaceObj) can throw an InvalidOperationException to let the caller know that an Interface could not be created from it.

Parameters:
interfaceObj - an object representing the interface
Returns:
true if the handler can create an Interface from the specified object; false otherwise

createInterfaceFor

com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Interface createInterfaceFor(java.lang.Object interfaceObj)
                                                      throws SAFException,
                                                             InvalidOperationException
Creates an SCA Interface from the given interface object.

The interface object can be an object supported by the canCreateInterfaceFor(Object interfaceObject) or returned by the IInterfaceUIHandler#getInterfaceObjects(IResource) method.

Parameters:
interfaceObj - the object representing the interface
Returns:
the new SCA Interface
Throws:
SAFException - An unexpected exception occurred.
InvalidOperationException - An interface cannot be created from the given interface object.

canCreateInterfaceObjectFor

boolean canCreateInterfaceObjectFor(com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Interface interfaze)
Queries if this handler can create an interface object for the supported type. If this method returns true, the handler's createInterfaceObjectFor(Interface) method may be called to create an interface object.

Parameters:
interfaze - The Interface from which an interface object needs to be created
Returns:
true if the handler can create an interface object; false otherwise

createInterfaceObjectFor

java.lang.Object createInterfaceObjectFor(com.ibm.ccl.soa.core.sca.Interface interfaze)
                                          throws SAFException,
                                                 InvalidOperationException
Creates a new interface object to be used by an SCA Interface.

Parameters:
interfaze -
Returns:
the new interface object
Throws:
SAFException - An unexpected exception occurred.
InvalidOperationException - The interface object cannot be created.
